meanings.definition: To move up and down in a jerky manner.
meanings.sent1: The jellyfish was bobbling in the water.
meanings.sent2: The bouncing ball was bobbling on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The bobbling puppy was chasing its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were bobbling in the wind like dancers.
meanings.sent5: The bobbling boat rocked gently on the waves.

meanings.definition: A small, repeated movement or vibration.
meanings.sent1: The bobbling of the keys in his pocket was distracting.
meanings.sent2: The bobbling of the phone on the table caught her attention.
meanings.sent3: The bobbling of the marbles in the jar sounded like music.
meanings.sent4: The bobbling of the coins in the piggy bank was a comforting sound.
meanings.sent5: The bobbling of the leaves in the breeze was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: She was bobbling the dance steps but kept smiling.
meanings.sent2: He was bobbling his lines during the play rehearsal.
meanings.sent3: The chef was bobbling the recipe but managed to save the dish.
meanings.sent4: The student was bobbling the math problem but eventually solved it.
meanings.sent5: The driver was bobbling the directions but finally reached the destination.
